intro: Aphyllodium novoguineense, commonly known as the New Guinea featherplant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters at the base of the plant. Aphyllodium novoguineense is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
